Design: Pluggable keyword schema navigation (JSON Pointer resolution)
description: The resolvePointerInSchemaWithBase function has hardcoded navigation logic for every keyword that contains subschemas (properties, items, allOf, etc.). For a truly pluggable keyword system, keywords need to declare: (1) Whether they contain subschemas, (2) How to navigate into them via JSON Pointers (simple property, map lookup, array index, etc.), (3) Location metadata for pointer resolution. Currently hardcoded keywords include: defs/definitions, properties/patternProperties/additionalProperties, items/prefixItems, allOf/anyOf/oneOf/not, if/then/else, dependentSchemas/contains/propertyNames, unevaluatedProperties. This blocks recursive validation in the pluggable system.

Embed standard JSON Schema metaschemas in library with composable loader
description:
## Goal
Embed official JSON Schema metaschemas (draft-04 through 2020-12) in the library to avoid network dependencies and enable vocabulary checking without external loaders.

## Design
1. Add data/metaschemas/ directory with official metaschemas from json-schema.org
2. Use file-embed or TH to bundle at compile time
3. Provide standardMetaschemaLoader that checks embedded schemas first
4. Support composition: embeddedLoader <|> customLoader to allow overriding/extending

## Benefits
- Self-contained: no HTTP fetching for standard schemas
- Reliable: always available, no network failures
- Fast: no I/O for common cases
- Enables fractal-yu6 fix to work properly in tests and production

## Related Issues
- Blocks fractal-yu6 (vocabulary checking needs metaschema access)
- Improves DX for library users

Draft202012: custom metaschema with no validation vocabulary - should not validate
description:
## Status
Core fix implemented but blocked by fractal-pth (need embedded metaschemas).

## What was fixed
- Added schemaMetaschemaURI field to Schema type to track $schema URI
- Modified getEffectiveVocabularies to look up metaschema in registry and extract vocabularies
- Updated validateObjectSchemaContentWithRefAnnotations to skip validation keywords when validation vocabulary is not active
- Updated collectExternalReferenceDocs to include $schema URIs in external refs

## What's blocking
Tests require loading custom metaschemas which reference standard metaschemas (e.g., https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/meta/applicator). Currently test infrastructure returns 'Unknown URI' errors. Need fractal-pth to embed standard metaschemas.

## Verification
Logic is correct - when metaschema is in registry with proper $vocabulary, validation keywords are correctly skipped. Test infrastructure issue only.
